intro: Phaeneilema koenigii, commonly known as the Indian borage, is a flowering plant native to the Indian subcontinent. It is characterized by its hairy, blue or purple flowers and oval-shaped leaves. The plant belongs to the Boraginaceae family, which includes other species with similar medicinal properties. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, often found in dry, rocky habitats. The leaves and flowers are used in traditional medicine for their potential anti-inflammatory and antispasmodic effects.
